basics.name: Robert Parnell
basics.label: Network Manager -- Advanced Routing and Enterprise Infrastructure Architect
basics.summary: Highly experienced Marine Corps Network Engineer with over two decades of expertise in designing, implementing, and securing mission-critical communications infrastructures. Proven track record in leading strategic network initiatives, optimizing secure data flow, and collaborating with international allies. Adept at leveraging automation tools and advanced routing technologies to enhance operational efficiency and resilience.

work.name: 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing
work.summary: Led advanced network infrastructure initiatives, focusing on SD-WAN, network automation, and VXLAN technologies to enhance performance, security, and scalability.
highlights: Engineered and deployed SD-WAN solutions to optimize multi-site connectivity, ensuring secure and efficient data transport across distributed environments.
Implemented **Red Hat Ansible** automation to streamline configuration management, reducing manual provisioning time by 50% and improving network consistency.
Designed and maintained **VXLAN-based network segmentation**, enabling scalable Layer 2 overlays across multi-classification environments.
Integrated **Cisco Catalyst Center** for centralized SD-WAN orchestration, improving network visibility, policy enforcement, and automation capabilities.
responsibilities: Managed and optimized enterprise network performance using real-time monitoring and analytics, including **BGP prefix tracking, telemetry, and event correlation**.
Led cross-functional collaboration to develop and implement **zero-trust security models**, leveraging **HAIPE, VPN, and MPLS encryption** for secure data transmission.
Developed and enforced **infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles**, using Ansible and Python to automate network configurations and reduce downtime.
Designed and implemented **high-availability network architectures**, ensuring redundancy and failover capabilities for mission-critical operations.
achievements: Reduced network downtime by 40% through **proactive automation and predictive analytics**, enhancing system resilience and operational efficiency.
Improved **SD-WAN performance and policy enforcement**, increasing bandwidth efficiency and reducing latency across multi-site deployments.
Enhanced **network segmentation and security posture** through VXLAN deployment, strengthening data integrity and compliance with security protocols.

work.name: 3rd Marine Expeditionary Brigade
work.summary: Designed, implemented, and optimized enterprise network infrastructure to support large-scale operations and cross-organizational collaboration..
highlights: Architected and enhanced network solutions to support high-availability operations, leveraging BGP, DMVPN, and SD-WAN technologies.
Led network infrastructure planning and integration efforts for multinational collaborations, improving cross-organization connectivity.
Drafted and coordinated Marine Network Operations Center (MNOC) support requests to ensure mission readiness
responsibilities: Designed and managed enterprise-scale network infrastructure, ensuring resilience, security, and operational efficiency.
Led cross-functional collaboration with domestic and international stakeholders to implement scalable network solutions.
Developed and enforced network security policies, integrating advanced cybersecurity measures to mitigate risks.
achievements: Successfully optimized multi-site network performance, reducing latency and improving overall system uptime.
Enhanced global interoperability by implementing robust network architectures supporting seamless data exchange.
Reduced manual configuration time by 40% through automation of network deployment and management processes.

work.name: 3rd Marine Division Communications Company
work.summary: Led network engineering efforts, enhancing mobile network capabilities and interoperability across operational terrains.
highlights: Enhanced interoperability by implementing OSPF, RIP, EIGRP, and BGP routing protocols.
Implemented traffic load balancing and DDoS mitigation strategies to ensure secure network performance.
Managed over 1,200 network prefixes for Pacific ground forces, ensuring optimal route-map configurations.
responsibilities: Designed and managed network architectures to support large scale operations.
Collaborated with US Joint Forces to enhance network security and efficiency.
Ensured high-availability and security of network infrastructure supporting strategic communications.
achievements: Improved network security and performance for forward-deployed forces.
Successfully mitigated multiple DDoS attacks through proactive measures.
Ensured high-availability communication channels in critical missions.

work.name: 3rd Assault Amphibian Battalion (AAV)
work.summary: Lead Network Administrator for 3rd Assault Amphibian Battalion.
highlights: Ensured secure and available networks during amphibious operations.
Maintained Unclassified and Secret network security compliance.
Supported large-scale Network Deployments as the G-6 Network Administrator Supervisor.
responsibilities: Oversaw installation and maintenance of networking assets for local units.
Ensured timely deployment and security of mobile network infrastructure.
Coordinated with higher headquaters to create joint network capabilties.
achievements: Successfully provided continuous network coverage during high-tempo operations.
Implemented network hardening measures to reduce vulnerabilities.
Enhanced communication capabilities for mobile amphibious forces.

work.name: Multiple Marine Corps Units
work.summary: Network & systems Administrator for Marine Corps installations and deployments.
highlights: Install, maintain, and troubleshoot enterprise network and telecommunications systems to ensure optimal performance.
Conduct fiber optic installations, modifications, and repairs, collaborating with engineers on infrastructure projects.
Interpret technical schematics, circuit diagrams, and building layouts to support accurate network deployment.
responsibilities: Coordinate with engineers and technicians to assist with installs, and maintain enterprise networking hardware and communication systems.
Inspect image versions and upgrade as needed.
achievements: Led the successful deployment of fiber optic infrastructure, improving network reliability and reducing downtime.
Reduced downtime by implementing proactive maintenance strategies.
Collaborated with engineers to optimize network installations, enhancing system performance and operational efficiency.

certificates.name: Cisco Certified Specialist - Enterprise Advanced Infrastructure Implementation
Palo Alto Networks Security Administrator Course
Implementing Cisco Enterprise Advanced Routing and Services
Implementing and Operating Cisco Enterprise Network Core Technologies

Includes a blog and contact form

projects.description: A web application that provides weather information for any location.

Responsive design

projects.name: Task Manager
projects.description: A simple task management app to keep track of daily tasks.
highlights: Built with Node.js and MongoDB
User authentication and CRUD operations

projects.name: E-commerce Site
projects.description: An online store built with Next.js and Stripe for payment processing.
highlights: Product management and shopping cart functionality
Secure payment integration
